Class Election

  • java.lang.Object
    • Election

  • public class Election
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Rakshith on 4/7/2017. Uses singleton pattern for Election class. There could be just one and only instance of Election. Handles all possible events of Election at the moment. This is the core class for election.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds data from outside pollPlaces to the main election.
      void closeElection()
      Closes the election for further votes.

      Removes the candidate having least votes from the election by distributing his votes to the next preferences votes.

      Uses the singleton Pattern to get a unique Instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getElectionInstance

        public static Election getElectionInstance()
        Uses the singleton Pattern to get a unique Instance. Implements the double check instantiation mechanism to achieve singularity in Election. Handles multithreaded environment issues.
        Returns:
        One and only Election Instance. Creates a new one if already not instantiated.

      • getCandidates

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Candidate> getCandidates()

      • getVotes

        public java.util.Map<Candidate,java.lang.Integer> getVotes()

      • isOpenStill

        public boolean isOpenStill()
        Checks if the opportunity for voting is allowed.
        Returns:
        true if there is still an opportunity to vote.

      • closeElection

        public void closeElection()
        Closes the election for further votes.

      • readCandidates

        public boolean readCandidates()
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads from the candidate file and passes the to the value to addCandidate() method which uses factory pattern to create a new candidate.
        Returns:
        true when successfully read. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • addCandidate

        public void addCandidate(java.lang.String candidateName,
                         java.lang.String partyName)
        Adds a candidate to the election. Uses FactoryPattern to create a Candidate. Calls createCandidate() in CandidateFactory class that returns a new appropriate candidate.
        Parameters:
        candidateName - name of the candidate to be added.
        partyName - name of party added.

      • addDataFromPolls

        public void addDataFromPolls(PollingPlace pollPlace,
                             java.util.List<java.util.Map<Candidate,java.lang.Integer>> votesList)
        Adds data from outside pollPlaces to the main election.
        Parameters:
        pollPlace - The Actual polling Place.
        votesList - preferences list of votes from the outside.

      • processVotesAndAssignToCandidates

        public void processVotesAndAssignToCandidates(int i)
        Go through every single pollPlace and add the ith preference votes to the votes Map. if i=0, gets the first preference votes -> No run off yet. if i=1, gets the second preference and so fourth. -> First run off and so on.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i> size of votesFromPollingPlaces.

      • isMajority

        public java.util.Map<Candidate,java.lang.Integer> isMajority()
        Checks if any candidate has votes larger than or equal to 50% +1vote of the total votes, who is actually the winner.
        Returns:
        a winner if found.

      • eliminateCandidate

        public java.lang.String eliminateCandidate(int i)
        Removes the candidate having least votes from the election by distributing his votes to the next preferences votes.
        Parameters:
        i - ith preference votes.
        Returns:
        name of the eliminated candidate.
